page.title: 17MOUNTAIN RESCUE
page.content: MY DAD IS IN THE TORRIDON AND KINLOCHEWE MOUNTAIN RESCUE TEAM. THEY WORK IN THE MOUNTAINS AROUND TORRIDON AND KINLOCHEWE. THERE ARE ABOUT TWENTY PEOPLE IN THE TEAM AND THEY ARE CALLED OUT ON AVERAGE SIX TIMES PER YEAR. THEY HAVE TO KNOW THE MOUNTAINS, ROPEWORK AND FIRST-AID. THEY ARE USUALLY CALLED OUT AROUND FOUR OR FIVE P.M. THEY DO MOST OF THEIR TRAINING AROUND SHIELDAIG. THEY TRAIN ON SATURDAYS MOSTLY AND SOMETIMES GO TO GLENMORE LODGE FOR A WEEK. AS THERE ARE MANY MOUNTAINS IN THIS AREA A MOUNTAIN RESCUE TEAM IS ESSENTIAL. MANY CLIMBERS COME AT ALL TIMES OF THE YEAR TO ENJOY CLIMBING AND THE GLORIOUS VIEWS OF THE AREA.
